p: For the 103N mutation in the reverse transcriptase we estimate a transmission ratio of 0.97 (95% HPD, [0.57-1.41]), which may imply that the mutation confers no significant fitness advantage or disadvantage. This major NNRTI mutation is associated with failure of current first-line treatment [ 2, 9, 45, 46] and currently is the most important NNRTI [ 47]. The lack of a disadvantage in transmission underlines the clinical importance of the 103N mutation in the context of TDR, particularly in resource limited settings.
